Posts.Content: I am also struggling to process the fact that I've got breast cancer, but I told my friends that they can ask me any question they like about it and what my treatments will be. I have also had flowers from people; how useless is that! I know it makes them feel like they have done something but i would prefer a supportive text or facebook message, or a good book/magazine to read.  This last year my me time has become less and less with work getting in the way. I have changed and will continue to do so and I know that I will not be doing any more unpaid overtime or working Sundays to help out. I come first.
Posts.Title: Fed up of cancer being the focus ...

Posts.Content: After my diagnosis I really only wanted my immediate household to know and the few people that I work closely with(they might have taken phone calls from the hospital) as I felt it was no-one else's business even though I knew they would want to help. I knew that things would soon be out of my control so I clung to that like mad. My mum decided to tell her hairdresser and I absolutely flipped.  I don't think you're being overly sensitive; this is very personal and very private and no-one else's business.   I think my Mum spoke out because she really didn't understand why this had happened to me and she really needed to talk to someone else about it. I know she didn't do it to hurt me but if felt like a complete betrayal of trust, but she had to talk about it to someone. Tell your Husband to pick and choose who he tells and that he has your permission first: its your decision not his. Remind him that he can speak to the Macmillan people himself if he needs to talk about it. Once i'd had my mastectomy I felt more able to share with friends and family and my attitude was that it was the beginning of a journey that was going to end and once it had started I could think about other things. I hated people discussing with me what might or might not happen during my treatment so armed myself with a lot of knowledge and that shut them up that way! Hope this helps, sorry if I've gone on a bit! Ali.24

Posts.Title: Nose

Posts.Content: I had right side mastectomy at the beginning of september and lymph node clearance.  I was a bit tight and sore after I went home but co-codamol sorted that out and you can quickly reduce those to paracetamol then nothing at all.  If you are given exercises to do make sure you do them. They will feel quite strange and again quite tight but you wont do any damage, but don't over do them. Keep in contact with your breast care nurses about anything worries you have at all: they are a fabulous group of people and nothing is trivial to them at all. You'll be just fine.
